the  current  level  of  output,  and  the  average  worker  puts  in  2,000  hours,  we

"A well-known result states that, in equilibrium, the real incomes of
 persons in risky activities are, at the margin, relatively high or low as
 persons are generally risk avoiders or preferrers. If offenders were risk
 preferrers, this implies that the real income of offenders would be lower,
 at the margin, than the incomes they could receive in less risky legal
 activities, and conversely if they were risk avoiders. Whether "crime pays"
 is then an implication of the attitudes offenders have toward risk and is
 not directly related to the efficiency of the police or the amount spent on
 combatting crime. If, however, risk were preferred at some values of p and
 f and disliked at others, public policy could influence whether "crime
 pays" by its choice of p andf. Indeed, it is shown later that the social loss
 from illegal activities is usually minimized by selecting p and f in regions
 where risk is preferred, that is, in regions where "crime does not pay.""

most organisms. The only organisms to use RNA to carry genetic information are

use DNA to carry genetic codes. But RNA molecules are used in our bodies for
many functions that do not require high level of precision and do not last very long,
for RNA molecules are cheaper to make than DNA. The chemical properties and

i remember when i first started majoring in financial planning (around 2009-10) i found out that prior to 2001 you had to meet the most minimal of requirements to give out financial advice. then in 2001, they lifted the knowledge requirement to like a cert III level before you could give advice as a planner. that wasn't the shocking thing. it was only in 2012 that FOFA started gaining momentum - rules to stop planners charging effectively life-long commissions on their clients by selling products from their 'preferred' vendor (which were note suited to their client at all), requirement to check up on their client after two years (instead of just set and forget while you reap commissions for decades) and to actually act in the best interest of their client. amazing.

Lol. I was going to say the same thing but with myself in place of yourself.

I think I am now more comfortable with remaining silent, instead of being anxious to maintain a "I am person with informed contribution to the discussion" airs to satisfy the big Other. Feel free to remain as silent as you want around me, I don't find silence unnerving like many humans do. We both know this world has infinite opinions in its coordinate system, including the underlying option to place those existing opinions into another paradigm. And that a million developments are occurring all the time and need to be addressed. Really I am seized by contradictions and ejaculating the latest interesting opinion I read seems like trying to display a false intellectualism. It all probably stems from having educated brothers that I can never seem to attain their level of (my perceived) intelligence, and also the underlying fear to prove that two degrees weren't a waste of tax dollars on me. So thatâs largely why I trip over wanting to discuss things with you.

The other thing is that you must confront a Jim that has glazed and confused expression on his face when you are saying things. But I am taking things on board and I do find it interesting, really. And what I've noticed in my self is how arbitrary and hermetically separated what it is that piques my own interest within different fields. Like how when it comes to my learning programming and its ilk, I am not interested in the slightest about being technologically proficient (with the latest hardware/software/gadgets) or the next IT entrepreneur or tech-guru or game-developer. What hit me is how ideal mathematical quibbling is and how computation is like the needle that hits the vinyl when it comes to concretely realising mathematics in nature (or at least, demonstrating its realisable âuseâ value in nature), and the peculiar language and notation that is used to perform this interaction. So now I have to begin AGAIN which is why I've been getting familiar with different branches of maths and logic (this time with a reason and not just curiosity). It was probably the whole nerd culture that drove me away â those guys seem smart and deep into the game and I donât care what you can do with an Oculist Rift or whatever lol. But that is irrelevant to me now. The other thing is I am not in a rush to talk about it or try to explain it (even though I am so excited about it) because I was just like "oh I need to do at least three years of solid mathematics and mathematical logic in order to feel comfortable with what is I am engaging with". Voevodsky is challenging much of the orthodoxy concerning the fundamentals of mathematics that erupted ever since the late 1800's. That's not something a smug edge-lord grad can comment upon lightly imo. Side note: Voevodsky is a sweet bumbling man in his lectures and his philosophical justification for reopening the argument (aside from the fact that his work demands this implication) was: "That our failure to prove that our mathematics is consistent should unnerve any rational mind.â  

In a similar vein, I enjoyed your take on the latest major deal involving Disney (I did see that crop up in the paper) but that kind of activity does not strike much interest for me. It is an American deal meaning vastly different implications than what it would be if it were in Australia. And the only thing I learned in accounting is that the figures that are floated around both newspapers and business-papers about what deals are "worth" and the revenue/profits quoted are mostly meaningless unless you can understand industry specific accounting conventions and are familiar with how accounting treats mergers and acquisitions. So when figures are floated I'm not really impressed or shocked, but that is not to say those figures aren't correct or significant! But what was great is that you related for me how the meaningful content that is produced by artists and handled by their corporate overlords operates, and what a deal like that affects fans and writers and many other variables. But it just demonstrates how important goings-on can be scanned and jettisoned in my mental life. Sometimes I feel like a robot to what is important to people.

The final thing is how my mind might appear to operate in a more sluggish manner than your own. I enjoy how your thought performs its leaps with ease, with such speed! And more often than not ending in something fucking hilarious or pleasurably terrifying! If I could explain how my mind works I would recount when Andre was teaching me mathematical induction and proofs last year. He's like "see, showing that all these other things hold is like showing that if we are able to place our foot sturdily on the first rung of a ladder, we can show how easily it is to climb a ladder using this same pattern to  pretty infinity." (Andre has to tone down his vocabulary for me). Jim's response: "But I'm having trouble understanding how it is you can say that we have even reached the first rung of the ladder!" Andre: "....I've never really thought about it that way, nor had the trouble with it."

Iâm never sure how to talk about it, but I figure here is as good a place as any to give you a heads up about something thatâs been on my mind a lot for a long time and has since been shown to be the case, at least with the one psychiatric professional I am in dialogue with about it. Psychiatrists, I am told, are diagnostic snowflakes, each with their own unique spin on what constitutes a diagnosis. So while not necessarily the rule itâs at least the case. 

I received an Autism Spectrum Disorder diagnosis that is along a profile of traits that used to be labelled Aspergers Syndrome before they integrated it with ASD (it was felt there was too little of a difference to warrant it being its own separate disorder in the DSM, however in the ICD-10, which is the WHOâs international diagnostic manual, it is still itâs own thing) and that would have been the diagnosis Iâd have received if I was given it as a child like one is typically meant to be with this sort of thing. That I wasnât diagnosed sooner is a credit to my intellect and ability to cope with my problems, so itâs not all bad and is in all a huge compliment to my will to overcome myself, but I canât help but feel a little betrayed in that I would have benefited from help specific to my set of chaotic deficits. 

Not that I am or would ever compare myself to Wittgenstein in any meaningful way (since he was a) pretty fucked-up and b) clearly his own particular brand of these issues), but reading Fitzgeraldâs psychobiography of him in relation to his life and work demonstrated to me that there exists a psychic landscape where I am not alone. The pursuit of solitude, reactive depression, denial/arrogance, fleeing into imagination and imitation elements that are common compensatory behaviours for someone living with the disorder, things laid out in psychobiographical texts about our boy Ludwig and his particular brand of human experience, were so revelatory for someone such as myself who has always felt at a loss to determine why I feel at best alien, or at worst defective and âde tropâ (to borrow his term). So I need to say thank-you for bringing Ludwig the human and his work out of my periphery and into my curiousity. 

So, I have made do with what are my givens. Or least up until the point where I was diagnosed and given medication to treat my still very real ADHD diagnosis, which is something that is regularly comorbid with ASD and is typically the first port of diagnostic call before layers are peeled away to let other stuff become visible and addressed if theyâre there and need tending. I can admit now that I have that need, as denying myself will only stunt me unnecessarily. I get severely depressed, paranoid, anxious, exhausted, moody, seized-up, bitter and occasionally suicidal (but thankfully thatâs not often and I have the resources to come out the other side of those feelings in one piece, albeit a little haunted), but being granted access to a pretty convincing source regarding why these things happen to me means that maybe Iâll have an easier time through accumulating processes I wasnât given during manufacturing and updates. Although of course there is the fear that learning how better to cope I will suddenly rob myself of some special formula that makes me who I am, itâs also apparent that like that game at Timezone with the hammers and the crocodiles there can be no slamming down all the troublemakers as the difficulty level rises, so the slightly hostile parts of my ego that fear being common (not the rapper. Fuck, actually gimme some of that sweet Badu pussy, pls life, pls, but minus all the private gigs for genocidal African dictators) can rest safely in the knowledge that I am far from becoming some completely socialised automatical dullard. 

More recently it became clear to me that treating my executive dysfunction didnât really keep me from experiencing distress in the laundry-list of areas that I didnât fully believe were things that place me deep in the interior of the Autism Spectrum, but these things unequivocally do put me there and I fully accept that now. After all, isnât everyone normal to themselves?

It doesnât change too much in that I more or less always knew through the characterisations I identify with that I was likely in the ranks of that slice of the population, but either way it will give me access to help where I didnât realise there was help, such as specific forms of CBT/DBT, how speech pathologists also do things like pragmatic language therapies for social communication, or accommodations for the heinous burnout that I didnât realise was a hallmark of people on the spectrum who are unfortunately required to âpassâ as otherwise in order to be independent to the standard of the wider population thatâs ignorant to how unaffected they are by disorder. Anxiety, depression, OCD, PTSD, social refusal and anger problems - problems that I struggle with - are the ugly flowers that bloom from the seed of the Autism Spectrum when thereâs only the one kind of dirt weâre all forced to draw nutrients from in order contribute to the biodome. 

But anyway, I just wanted you to know because it matters that the humans I love understand me better so that we can all understand each other better. Iâm not going to broadcast it because it doesnât require meds and itâs my business, although letâs not go down the rabbit hole of the subject of âLoveâ because all the longest sections in the books Iâm referencing at the moment have to do with how problematic a thing it is for autistics. I know it goes without saying youâre someone I trust implicitly to respect my privacy on the matter when I am the subject of your discourse with others, but at the same time I feel obligated to give the âkeep it under your luscious red maneâ alert, mainly just because the unspoken is my enemy, as I know it is yours, and it kills any anxiety I might experience about public awareness of these issues by stating it outright and then moving on to other more fruitful discussions.

It just explains so much. I am currently chewing through a text I have been recommended on the subject and it is enlightening in that it is a near-complete and systematic breakdown of my divergences from the oft-discussed ânormâ. Iâm looking forward to growing beyond this diagnosis,  leaning in to all the enviable traits that result from this, accessing all the necessary accommodations at work and uni to keep my head in the game and working with a new psychologist to create contingencies that will hopefully result in a semblance of balance to offset the deficits within and outside of my awareness. As well I will hopefully being given a peek at the playbook of the social realm that is currently only written in a shitty non-english that I always felt to have no useful references, footnotes or revisions specific to era or locale. 

Anyhow, sorry for the long rant, but I wanted to let you know all of this because after having it all confirmed and laid out yesterday morning with my psychiatrist I could only think about how to convey the information and writing this has been incredibly therapeutic. I keep revising this, but Iâm going to stop now. Ask me anything and everything, or nothing, itâs all good. Itâs just something that I needed to do. Also, seeing you on Sunday was brilliant, Meg and I canât stand weeks where youâre not around in some capacity. 

I tried to make this as ridiculous as possible so as to be palatable, so I hope it was an entertaining as well as informative read.

The literature describes the Gothic mode of acquisition within the ASX as one characterised by surprise -and often hostile - takeovers, and positions that gain only from aggressive short-selling. Such plundering activity causes reverberations among market participants with many engaging in the Gothic mode despite high levels of asymmetrical information which often leads to investors jettisoning long-term plans and (almost willingly) paying whatever is demanded of them by market close. Market disruption of this scale leaves balance sheets weak, with many funds using the AGM to bury any disorientation managers exhibited during the financial year. 
In this study, several fake funds are setup in order to counter such market reaction by leading herd activity into more rational transactions through sheer scale. We find that the observable impact of the experiment to be negligible, and conclude that any influence from this type of behavior is only recognised by quant-funds (who are already in on it anyway).

telstra announces dividend reduction for future years in order to divert payments to capital expenditure over next few years in order to guard against the changing nbn environment and develop business in new areas. both were expected by the market to occur sometime soon. share price drops 10%.

i had a dream a few nights ago, but i didn't want to say because i feel we didn't go through your dreams enough. 

i think the themes of the dream were derived largely from imagining who i would be when jesus rode into town on a donkey, just before i went to sleep. i pictured myself as disheveled shut-in who views jesus from my third story apartment window. i look at him suspiciously, hear the cheers, and close the blinds. it was because i was reading about hegel's seeing napoleon. 

anyway. most of the imagery is vague. but. the scenario was the trial of two criminals in front of a crowd, and the cheers determined who got freed. it was on a stage made of jutting blue stone slabs (geelong, melbourne, obvs.). 
meg, you, and myself were hanging at the back of the crowd (we were wearing the garb of jesus' times (as conveyed to me by daytime tv retellings)). when the time came to cheer for the freedom of the second criminal, there was very little cheer. so i contributed a cheer in a 'fine i will do the custom but in a mocking way because it is stupid' manner. i giggle and turn to you and meg, who have stopped eating the hummus that was left on a table while everyone is distracted by the trial. you guys were like 'why the fuck would you do that?' and i was like shrug the shoulders laughing, while not realising the danger i have put us in.
but he also makes it funny. much of it is "i wasn't there for the battle or when they spoke at negotiations, but it probably went something a little like EXACTLY HOW I DESCRIBE IT TO YOU NOW"

A good example in an academic context is that I am really good at making a logically structured single-page cheat sheet for an exam and then by having made it I have memorised it, so when I get in to the exam I just close my eyes and see it again and recreate it on the exam paper, using it as a guide. It's how I looked like I knew maths but in a practical manner actually was really terrible at the reading and comprehension side of it so seemed like I was a total moron. One of my maths teachers even once advised a friend in confidence that I wasn't worth asking for help in class.

Remember when we were walking to Milk the Cow and I couldn't get that scene of the Doctor of Horticulture performing an emergency Colonic Irrigation procedure on a flight to a man whose abdomen was bloated, but perhaps not suffering from a heart attack but an obstruction causing potentially life-threatening amounts of gas retention? That's a good example of visual spatial learning/processing in that I still remember that whole scene perfectly and at the time I was subjected to having a detailed space intrude upon my present mind and I basically had to resolve the scene to make it go away or otherwise I'd be stuck on it.

My psychiatrist described it really well, but he also described it as essentially being in the realm of dyslexia and then suggested I be tested for dyslexia. That is something I've been avoiding since I first heard about it in Grade 4. Something tells me two diagnoses in one semester might be pushing it in terms of understanding the fine details of my perceptions.

It always puzzles me when men proclaim "all men are brothers" as reason to be tolerant of one another when out in the wild, when not even "all brothers are brothers". But I guess I'm less of a Francisco De Miranda and more of a Francisco De Carrie Bradshaw in my belief that sometimes you make your family or sometimes you're born into it and that's just sort of how it is and it isn't much farther from that, because I suppose without others you don't form much of a language or have anyone to convey anything to. It's another school that's not worth subscribing to wholeheartedly. The percolator was just a wild stab in the dark, but it felt appropriate nevertheless. Weâre really happy you appreciate it! A system for precisely extracting yourself a shot of good-quality coffee at home sounds to me like giving the gift of a crack pipe that likely wonât send you to too early a grave, but still provide the euphoric hit often associated. 

I too know the feeling of wanting to talk the shapes and contours of a subject and attempting to identify what it encircles hoping to be enlightened enough to perhaps see what encircles it. I appreciate most the quality of hoping to catch one's assumptions and biases as they rise up from the ether of the unconscious, or god forbid somehow manage to leave the conscious mind through the mouth, so as to study them and hope to change how these poor conceptions operate out in the wild in a way that whatever is there in the unconscious that's scanning and processing the heinous amount of data we wade through from bookending breaths can then pay some of whatever constitutes its mind towards making sure at some stage it sends something less embarrassing to the surface for us to have to deal with. 

I wouldnât worry about proselytising oneâs perceived inferiority of self. Presuming to know anything is the enemy. Playing with what you think you know is the noblest game. For all intents and purposes one knows nothing, one only thinks they do. Because absolutes are beyond our fragile senses but not beyond the imagination of our fragile minds, itâs a perfectly reasonable conclusion. Itâs our prison to know how narrow we see. Your order of operations sounds ideal. Point-counterpoint. As Feldman would say, do it one way and then do it another. A lot of people seem to me to pretend they have it all figured out, but no one does, so they play the fool. And not the cool and quietly wise fool of Lear, but the real fool of Lear himself; the dime a dozen motherfuckers we know all too well who call themselves âreal menâ at the expense of much.

I suppose the part omitted is that eventually, like in Ã rebours, I have to return to civilisation despite my distaste for it.

The following evening the the Central American plot I am checking in to an apartment, the key being one of the useable items pilfered from the affluent family. I spent time inspecting the house and removing items that tie directly to them. I won't be staying for long but either way I don't want to arouse any suspicion. Just as I'm tidying the last of it my Dad and Brother arrive, impressed at how well I'm doing and excited to spend our evening catching up with such a spectacular view from all sides of the apartment. I quip something about how I can't justify staying there long, that it's a loan with a heavy debt.

Then it cuts to me sorting through the identification and personal effects of the family while I am in my bungalow, it looks to be early morning. As I'm sorting between useable items and identifiers that I need to destroy it flashes between what I'm doing there and me doing similar things regarding the detective and the disfigured man. All have been murdered off-camera.

In a single run of climaxes it is revealed that I am the one recounting the schemes of the disfigured man to him as he is bound in a chair in front of me, that I murder the detective for finding out that I am indeed guilty of the crimes that the disfigured man had accused me of committing to others and that the father suddenly comes to the realisation that he and his family are in danger and that his suspicions have placed them in that predicament.
As I'm talking about Ã rebours to the family, the narrative weaves together with the claims of the disfigured man and the questions of the detective regarding the nature of my visit.

Meanwhile, sometime around sunset, I'm describing the history of French literary decadence to the family. The father is growing increasingly suspicious of my story, starting to attempt to find holes in autobiographical claims that I have been making over the course of the evening. He is worldly and he may know the truth after all, or at least he capable of deduction.

As the flashbacks keep moving I'm visiting the detective in their home. She seems to be putting up a front that it's okay for an unexpected visit. The man making claims against me is narrating over a series of reveals the fact that it was all an elaborate rouse and that he had intended to have me discredited and imprisoned. His rationale was that, while he had not been harmed, he knew I had done so to others and felt it was his responsibility to put me away.

Back on the Central American coast the father is quietly harbouring suspicions of me, I can tell. He knows something. I know a lot about the world, more than just being some well-educated heir would leave me with. He can tell I've bled and bled others.

As the night plays onwards the narrative I weave plays off against flashbacks. I'm a slightly younger professional in a city that's half Melbourne half European. Two stories played out, one where I am visiting a police inspector at her home and the other where a man of affluence (who I cannot say the dream described the occupation of) claiming I disfigured him, but I slowly bring to light that these claims were false.

We ran into one another on this beach and after finding commonalities we decided to set up a fire by the shore and I invited them to stay in my well outfitted bungalow. There was a motorcycle there, a jeep in the garage. They need to know who I am, what sort of world bred me, so they take me up on my generosity.

The father is a business man of no type I care to know, but I appeal to his sensibilities due to my overly inquisitive mind. The wife has taste and intelligence, she wishes she was younger and single but is happy admiring as I am more than capable of charming her within the bounds of propriety. Besides, they seem to fancy the notion of playing matchmaker with their beautiful daughter.

Cold open to me on a beach, somewhere in affluent and coastal Central America. I'm entertaining a couple in their late-50's and their daughter in her early twenties. I feel I'm in my thirties but it doesn't seem to come up.
Last night's dream was spectacular.

"the pure "subject of the Enlightenment" is a monster which gives body to the surplus that escapes the vicious circle of the mirror relationship. In this sense, monsters can be defined precisely as the fantasmatic appearance of the "missing link" between nature and culture: as a kind of "answer of the real" to the Enlightenment's endeavor to find the bridge that links culture to nature, to produce a "man/woman of culture" who would simultaneously conserve his/her unspoiled nature. Therein consists the ambiguity of the Enlightenment: the question of "origins" (origins of language, of culture, of society) which emerged in all its stringency with it, is nothing but the reverse of a fundamental prohibition, the prohibition to probe too deeply into the obscure origins, which betrays a fear that by doing so, one might uncover something monstrous."

Sellars: âOne is tempted, therefore, to contrast the analytic conception of philosophy as myopia with the synoptic vision of true philosophy. And it must be admitted that if the contrast between 'analysis' and 'synthesis' were the operative connotation in the metaphor, then a purely analytic philosophy would be a contradiction in terms. Even if we construe 'analysis' on the analogy of making ever smaller scale maps of the same over all terrain, which does more justice to the synoptic element, the analogy disturbs because we would have to compare philosophy to the making of small-scale maps from an original large-scale map; and a smaller scale map in this sense is a triviality.
Even if the analogy is changed to that of bringing a picture into focus, which preserves the synoptic element and the theme of working within the frame work of what is already known while adding a dimension of gain, the analogy is disturbingâ¦[for two reasons]â

Hannibal has his mind palace for a few different reasons. It works as a library for verbatim recall of facts and sense memories, it works as a place he can inhabit during incarceration when the ward becomes unbearable, it's there to alleviate boredom during the aforementioned incarceration of dull stuff like shitty patients. But all of that exists within the context of him also being able to juggle multiple thought-streams without distraction. Sort of like Quantum Thinking. In the books he has his hemispherical connection damaged, which can cause this in people, albeit in a uncoordinated and disjointed form (limbs can't coordinate, etc).
I don't believe there is a definitive answer as to whether how I live counts as living in the social realm.
The latter of which being as much an institutionalisation as the literal one.

- End up a mysterious figure of practices what should be conventional but somehow through the personal filter system that is their brain cannot for their life make something that is relatable to the external mass of minds.
- Form a cult in the institution.
- Be Hospitalised.

"...one is the idea of intellectual property; [AND] new productive ideas are often owned. But this is not really compatible with the view that technological progress is exogenous. It means that a firm owns an idea because it has invested in it. There is also a second factor in the slowness of diffusion; acquiring already existing information is itself costly.... 
...The information is typically about the rate of return, not the amount. Hence, its value to the investor depends on the amount invested. We would expect that those with more wealth will buy more information, so that the rate of return on what they have invested should on the average be higher. There is some evidence that this is in fact true empirically.... 
...There are alternative sources of information. It follows that there is a trade-off between the quality of the information and its cost. Investors may tend to use readily available information, such as transactions on observable markets, rather than better but scarcer information... 
...the recognition that individuals hold differing information. The term, asymmetric information... 
...The failure of the market to operate too well in these circumstances has led to a literature, usually called mechanism design, on creating incentives, usually within firms, to achieve some improvement. 
...It is also true that uncertainty and informational problems can prevent markets from emerging... For it to exist, it is necessary that all parties understand what state of nature has occurred. This is a condition on the information held by the economic agents involved.
It is the market failure that makes information seeking so important...getting information is very subtle. Essentially, we make inferences about the inferences made by others."

"Much of the fit-out for the ANZ tower in Melbourne's Docklands will be created through the bank's collaboration with local manufacturer and designer Zenith Interiors.

Back in the 1950's Zenith was making office partitions. Today it's creating the office hardware that enables the rapid evolution of corporate workplaces into more fluid arrangements.

Flexible workplaces mean more staff in less space, saving money. They also allow radically new ways of working. Creativity and collaboration pay off for employers as well. At 839 Collins Street, Zenith is taking that trend even further. Almost everything will be on wheels and able to moved around as the bank's staff shape and match their office space to work demands.

"All the traditional furniture items have been designed to be modular and mobile to maximise flexibility of the workplace," says Zenith's national sales manager Peter Appel.

That flexibility will extend into break-out spaces and even kitchenettes, which can be unplugged and moved. Another upside for a tenant is its capacity to vacate a space with limited "make-good" requirements."

"Conclusion 
We study the relation between fund managersâ family backgrounds and their professional performance and find that managers from poor families deliver higher risk-adjusted returns than managers from rich families. Our evidence suggests that managers endowed with a low economic status at birth face higher entry barriers into asset management, and only the highest-quality candidates succeed in entering the profession. This explanation is supported by the evidence on managersâ promotions, which shows that managers with a low endowed status must deliver higher returns to stand a comparable chance of promotion with their high-status peers. We also document that, consistent with the selection mechanism, managers from wealthier backgrounds show a much higher dispersion in their performance than managers of modest decent. 
We believe our findings have implications that extend beyond asset management. Our evidence suggests that an individualâs social status at birth may serve as an important signal of quality in other industries with high barriers to entry, such as corporate management or professional services. We hope that an increased focus on the role of an agentâs family background will yield valuable insights into professional decisions of financial intermediaries, corporate managers, and other economic agents. "

It must lie outside the world.

IM humble O, shares represent firms that actually make and do things of substance, substance here being a customer need that can be profited from. when we have low inflation, central banks lower interest rates to spur growth, as cheap money is meant to be an incentive to lend and invest. but low rates mean low yields on bonds and instruments that are the staple diets of banks, super funds, other conservative funds, have relied upon for like, history. this is in an environment where wage growth (in both size and frequency) is slow. when inflation is low, workers accept lower wages which then in turn feeds into lower inflation. repeat cycle. what the article i quoted from was saying, firms were worried about reinvesting returns as opposed to distributing it back to investors. where i am lost is if there is so much cash going into r&d and capital expenditure programs, what is the demand or strategy for that further spending? i am a fan of reinvestment and r&d because you dont know how long your niche lasts. it seems like it is about maintaining capital, at the expense of returns. it may be to prolong the life of the firm and its workers, it may be because that is the herd strategy and people mirror it saying that is what investors want in this climate, it may be so complex you die.
